IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY IS TO EQUIP OUR STUDENTS FOR MEANINGFUL LIVES AND PRODUCTIVE CAREERS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY IS TO EQUIP OUR STUDENTS FOR MEANINGFUL LIVES AND PRODUCTIVE CAREERS.
IRS990.Description: UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY IS A COMPREHENSIVE, PRIVATE UNIVERSITY THAT OFFERS BOTH UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDIES AND IS ACCREDITED BY THE HIGHER LEARNING COMMISSION. UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY OFFERS MORE THAN 60 AREAS OF UNDERGRADUATE STUDY AND HAS A CURRENT UNDERGRADUATE ENROLLMENT OF NEARLY 2,825 STUDENTS. SOME OF THE MORE POPULAR UNDERGRADUATE PROGRAMS INCLUDE: BUSINESS (373 STUDENTS), EDUCATION (243 STUDENTS), HEALTH PROFESSIONS (537 STUDENTS), PHARMACY (242 STUDENTS), LIBERAL ARTS (343 STUDENTS), NATURAL SCIENCE (962 STUDENTS) AND OTHER (125 STUDENTS). MANY OF THE UNIVERSITY'S PROGRAMS HAVE A NATIONAL REPUTATION INCLUDING PRE-VETERINARY MEDICINE AND EQUESTRIAN STUDIES.

Activity2.Description: UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY OFFERS A VARIETY OF GRADUATE PROGRAMS INCLUDING: MASTERS OF BUSINESS (460 STUDENTS), EDUCATION (402 STUDENTS), HEALTH PROFESSIONS SUCH AS PHYSICAL THERAPY, OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY AND ATHLETIC TRAINING (193 STUDENTS), PHARMACY (51 STUDENTS), LIBERAL STUDIES (58 STUDENTS) AND SCIENCE (104 STUDENTS). TOTAL GRADUATE STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED ARE MORE THAN 1,268.

Activity3.Description: UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY HAS MANY AUXILIARY DEPARTMENTS THAT PROVIDE SERVICES TO THEIR STUDENTS, THESE AUXILIARY DEPARTMENTS INCLUDE DORMITORIES FOR STUDENT LIVING, DINING HALLS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, CAMPUS STORES FOR STUDENTS AND THE UNIVERSITY'S ON-CAMPUS VETERINARY CLINIC.

Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: ASSISTANT VICE PRESIDENT/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE ALL HAZARDS TRAINING CENTER

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE C, PART II-B, LINE 1G
Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY PAID A RETAINER TO A LOBBYIST FOR ASSISTANCE IN RECEIVING GRANTS FOR THE UNIVERSITY. WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE LOBBYIST, THE UNIVERSITY WAS ABLE TO RECEIVE SEVERAL $100,000 IN GRANTS IN PRIOR YEARS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Collections of art - description of collections
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE MAZZA MUSEUM IS DEDICATED TO COLLECTING, EXHIBITING AND PRESERVING ORIGINAL ART FROM CHILDREN'S PICTURE BOOKS. THE MUSEUM IS THE WORLD'S FIRST AND LARGEST TEACHING MUSEUM DEVOTED TO LITERACY AND THE ART OF CHILDREN'S PICTURE BOOKS. FOUNDED IN 1982, THE MUSEUM CONTAINS MORE THAN 3,000 ORIGINAL ARTWORKS.
THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES PRESCRIBES RECOGNITION THRESHOLDS AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTES FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. TAX BENEFITS WILL BE RECOGNIZED ONLY IF A TAX POSITION IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT SUSTAINED IN A TAX EXAMINATION, WITH A TAX EXAMINATION BEING PRESUMED TO OCCUR. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED WILL BE THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY BEING REALIZED ON EXAMINATION. FOR TAX POSITIONS NOT MEETING THE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TEST, NO TAX BENEFIT WILL BE RECORDED. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THEY ARE UNAWARE OF ANY TAX BENEFITS OR LIABILITIES TO BE RECOGNIZED AT JUNE 30, 2010. THE UNIVERSITY WOULD RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN INTEREST AND INCOME TAX EXPENSE, RESPECTIVELY. THE UNIVERSITY HAS NO AMOUNTS ACCRUED FOR INTEREST OR PENALTIES FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010. THE UNIVERSITY IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2007. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT EXPECT THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS TO SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGE IN THE NEXT 12 MONTHS.
CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP - -207999; OTHER - 0; TOTAL - -207999

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: UF CH OF GOD TUITION ADJ

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES STUDENTS IF THEY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR SPECIFIC ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIPS. ONCE NOTIFIED, STUDENTS FILL OUT AN APPLICATION TO APPLY FOR THE RESPECTIVE SCHOLARSHIP. IF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS FOR A SPECIFIC PROGRAM, THE DEAN OR OTHER FACULTY MEMBER FOR THAT PROGRAM WILL REVIEW THE APPLICATIONS AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND WHO SHOULD RECEIVE THE AWARD. FINANCIAL AID VERIFIES AGAIN IF THE STUDENT IS STILL ELIGIBLE FOR THE AWARD AND ISSUES THE FUNDS TO THE RECOMMENDED STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS THE USE OF THE FUNDS TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: Housing allowance or residence for personal use
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS. THIS BENEFIT IS CONSIDERED NONTAXABLE PURSUANT TO IRC SECTION 119.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Review of form 990 by governing body
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A FINAL DRAFT OF THE FULL FORM 990, INCLUDING ALL APPLICABLE SCHEDULES, WAS PRESENTED BY OUR TAX ADVISORS TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE PRESENTATION ALLOWS THE COMMITTEE AND MANAGEMENT TO REVIEW AND PROVIDE COMMENTS AND EXPLANATIONS REGARDING CHANGES TO THE REDESIGNED FORM. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWED AND APPROVED THE FORM 990 ON BEHALF OF THE ENTIRE GOVERNING BODY. THIS PRESENTATION WAS DONE ON FEBRUARY 10, 2011. THE FULL GOVERNING BODY RECEIVED A COPY OF THE FULL FORM 990 ELECTRONICALLY PRIOR TO THE FORM BEING SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD MEMBERS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTERESTS THEY MAY HAVE WITH THE ORGANIZATION. THE VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS AFFAIRS REVIEWS EACH POLICY STATEMENT SIGNED BY THESE INDIVIDUALS TO DETERMINE IF ANY CONFLICTS HAVE OCCURRED AND NEED TO BE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD. IF A CONFLICT ARISES, THE RESPECTIVE BOARD MEMBER WILL ABSTAIN FROM ANY RELATED DISCUSSION, VOTE OR SIMILAR ACTION ON THE MATTER.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process used to establish compensation of top management official
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HAS BEEN GIVEN AUTHORITY FROM THE BOARD TO REVIEW AND APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT AND THE TREASURER (VP OF BUSINESS AFFAIRS) OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE USES COMPARABILITY DATA FROM HIGHER EDUCATION SALARY SURVEYS, NOTABLE FROM THE INFORMATION PUBLISHED BY COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR HUMAN RESOURCES (CUPA-HR). ONCE THE COMPENSATION HAS BEEN REVIEWED AND APPROVED THE DECISION IS DOCUMENTED WITHIN THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE'S MINUTES. THE LAST REVIEW WAS PERFORMED IN FYE 2009 AS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DID NOT MEET DURING FYE 2010.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE NOT REQUIRED DISCLOSURES PURSUANT TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) SECTION 6104. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THIS TIME.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Financial aid or assistance from a governmental agency
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE: PASSED THROUGH THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY, EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT PROGRAM. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR: OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION, OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH - SUSAN HARWOOD TRAINING. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION: BYRD HONORS SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CLUSTER: FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANTS, FEDERAL FAMILY EDUCATION LOANS, FEDERAL WORK-STUDY PROGRAM, FEDERAL PERKINS LOAN PROGRAM, FEDERAL PELL GRANT PROGRAM, FEDERAL DIRECT LOANS, ACADEMIC COMPETITIVENESS GRANTS, NATIONAL SCIENCE AND MATHEMATICS ACCESS TO RETAIN TALENT (SMART) GRANTS, TEACHER EDUCATION ASSISTANCE FOR COLLEGE AND HIGHER EDUCATION (TEACH) GRANTS. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES: PASSED THROUGH THE GREATER CINCINNATI OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH CENTER NIEHS HAZARDOUS WASTE WORKER HEALTH AND SAFETY TRAINING, PASS THROUGH THE AKRON REGIONAL HOSPITAL NATIONAL BIOTERRORISM HOSPITAL PREPAREDNESS PROGRAM. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY: PASS THROUGH EASTERN KENTUCKY UNIVERSITY STATE AND LOCAL HOMELAND SECURITYTRAINING PROGRAM, PASS THROUGH THE NATIONAL SHERIFF'S ASSOCIATION STATE AND LOCAL HOMELAND SECURITY TRAINING PROGRAM, PASS THROUGH WYANDOTT COUNTY, OHIO STATE AND LOCAL HOMELAND SECURITY TRAINING PROGRAM, PASS THROUGH HANCOCK COUNTY, OHIO EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT PERFORMANCE GRANTS, PASS THROUGH THE OHIO EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT ASSOCIATION HOMELAND SECURITY GRANT PROGRAM, PASS THROUGH THE EASTERN KENTUCKY UNIVERSITY COMPETITIVE TRAINING GRANTS. RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT CLUSTER U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES: OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH PROGRAM, PASS THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY OF TOLEDO, PASS THROUGH THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH INSTITUTE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION - INVESTIGATIONS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: COMPENSATION PROCESS OF OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION OF THE OFFICERS IS DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT. HOWEVER, THE PRESIDENT DOES NOT USE COMPARABILITY DATA. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2009.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE L, PART III, COLUMN (B) AND PART IV, COLUMN (B)
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: W&B REALTY LTD IS AN ENTITY THAT IS 50% OWNED BY RICHARD WHITE, THE CURRENT VICE CHAIR OF THE BOARD, AND 50% OWNED BY RICHARD BECKETT, THE CURRENT CHAIR OF THE BOARD. W&B REALTY LTD OWNED APARTMENT BUILDINGS THAT WERE RENTED FOR A TOTAL OF $156,000 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY. THESE APARTMENT BUILDINGS WERE THEN PURCHASED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY FROM W&B REALTY FOR A PURCHASE PRICE OF $173,327. THE APARTMENT BUILDINGS WERE MORE THAN $173,327; THEREFORE, THE REMAINDER OF THE BUILDING PRICE OF $679,146 IS A NONCASH CONTRIBUTION MADE BY W&B REALTY LTD AS SHOWN ON SCHEDULE L, PART III, COLUMN (B).

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE K, PART I, LINE A, COLUMN F
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY (THE UNIVERSITY) IS AN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) EXEMPT EDUCATIONAL ORGANIZATION THAT WAS ONE OF TWO SUCH BENEFICIARIES OF THE FOLLOWING OHIO HIGHER EDUCATIONAL FACILITY COMMISSION (THE "COMMISSION") POOLED FINANCING: $15,715,000 STATE OF OHIO HIGHER EDUCATIONAL FACILITY VARIABLE RATE DEMAND REVENUE BONDS (POOLED FINANCING 2003 PROGRAM) SERIES B ISSUED NOVEMBER 13, 2003 AS INDICATED IN COLUMN (E), $5,080,150 OF THE POOLED FINANCING BENEFITTED THE UNIVERSITY. THE OTHER BENEFICIARY OF THE POOLED FINANCING WAS OHIO DOMINICAN UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY USED THE POOLED FINANCING PROCEEDS TO ASSIST IN REFUNDING AND RETIRING THE FOLLOWING BANK DEBTS: FIFTH THIRD BANK LOAN NO. 0101983296-000000109 DATED: 1/1/2000 PRINCIPAL AMOUNT PAID WITH ISSUE PROCEEDS $661,156.93 FIFTH THIRD BANK LOAN NO. 09019982296-000000125 DATED: 1/1/2002 PRINCIPAL AMOUNT PAID WITH ISSUE PROCEEDS $227,651.71 FIFTH THIRD BANK LOAN NO. 0901983296-000000117 DATED: 1/1/2001 PRINCIPAL AMOUNT PAID WITH ISSUE PROCEEDS $510,237.73 SKY BANK NOTE NO. 1300360836 DATED: 1/1/2000 PRINCIPAL AMOUNT PAID WITH ISSUE PROCEEDS $218,834.00 SKY BANK NOTE NO. 6000250505 DATED: 1/1/2002 PRINCIPAL AMOUNT PAID WITH ISSUE PROCEEDS $1,500,827.56 FIRST FEDERAL BANK OF THE MIDWEST ACCOUNT NO. 34-4431169/66110843 DATED: 1/1/2003 PRINCIPAL AMOUNT PAID WITH ISSUE PROCEEDS $1,813,646.97 THE PROCEEDS FROM THESE LOANS HAD BEEN USED FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS CONSISTING OF THE ACQUISITION OF REAL PROPERTY THAT WAS CONVERTED TO USE AS STUDENT HOUSING AND THE RENOVATION OF STUDENT DINING FACILITIES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE K, PART I, LINE B, COLUMN F
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY OF FINDLAY (THE UNIVERSITY) WAS ONE OF FOUR INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) EXEMPT EDUCATION ORGANIZATIONS THAT WERE THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE FOLLOWING COMMISSION POOLED FINANCING: $36,080,000 STATE OF OHIO HIGHER EDUCATIONAL FACILITY VARIABLE RATE REVENUE BONDS (POOLED FINANCING 2006 PROGRAM) SERIES A ISSUED JUNE 29, 2006 AS INDICATED IN COLUMN (E), $18,260,000 OF THE POOLED FINANCING BENEFITTED THE UNIVERSITY. THE OTHER BENEFICIARIES OF THE POOLED FINANCING WERE THE OHIO COLLEGE OF PODIATRIC MEDICINE, URBANA UNIVERSITY AND WALSH UNIVERSITY. $10,056,686 OF THE POOLED FINANCING PROCEEDS BENEFITTING THE UNIVERSITY WAS USED TO REFUND OHIO HIGHER EDUCATIONAL FACILITY COMMISSION REVENUE BONDS ISSUED NOVEMBER 1, 1996 FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE UNIVERSITY. THOSE BONDS WERE ISSUED TO FINANCE CAPITAL EXPENDITURES FOR THE ACQUISITION, CONSTRUCTION, RENOVATION, EQUIPPING AND FURNISHING OF VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES, CERTAIN COMPUTER AND EQUIPMENT SYSTEMS AND OTHER CAMPUS IMPROVEMENTS. THE BALANCE OF THE POOLED FINANCING PROCEEDS BENEFITTING THE UNIVERSITY WAS USED FOR CAPITAL EXPENDITURES CONSISTING OF THE PURCHASE AND RENOVATION OF CLASSROOM FACILITIES AND OTHER REAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH VARIOUS DEGREE PROGRAMS.
